snippet: City Council speaker Christine C. Quinn’s proposal would impose a 30-year cap on real estate taxes for landlords who set aside 20 percent of their apartments for below-market rents.
abstract: New York City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn, in her annual State of the City address, calls for a 30-year cap on real estate taxes for landlords who set aside 20 percent of their apartments for below-market rents.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and CHARLES V. BAGLI

lead_paragraph: City Council speaker Christine C. Quinn’s proposal would impose a 30-year cap on real estate taxes for landlords who set aside 20 percent of their apartments for below-market rents.

headline.seo: Quinn’s Affordable Housing Plan Revisits Tax Caps Rejected by Bloomberg
headline.main: Quinn’s Affordable Housing Plan Revisits Tax Caps Once Rejected by Bloomberg
headline.print_headline: Quinn’s Affordable Housing Plan Revisits Tax Caps Once Rejected by Bloomberg

keywords.value: Real Estate Board of New York
keywords.name: organizations
